metadata.name: Code Page 437 // Ishihara #60
metadata.description:
In order to understand what you see before your eyes you must first open this artwork in both Firefox and any other web browser of your choice, at the same time, to experience it as intended.

A combination of ishihara palettes and cross-browser bugs are used to explore neurodiversity by forcing the viewer to take additional manual steps to see the world from a different perspective. A whole new understanding of colour blindness should unfold as you struggle through inaccessibility yourself.

The 640x400px canvas consists of 25 rows, with 80 columns per row for a total of 2000 letters, using only 16 glyphs from the Codepage 437 character set scaled to a resolution of 8x16 pixels per character.

Codepage 437 is the original IBM PC-ASCII font from August 1981, often referred to as the DOS font.

metadata.name: Gate to nowhere #6
metadata.description:
Still around the corner, a new road and a new gate can wait for us, only to discover they lead nowhere.

Press [s] to save the output .png format (press [h] wait for rendering, then press [s] to save at higher resolution).

Better experience in live mode.

Generative artwork by Gandhiavelli, @gandhiavelli. Made with p5js in February 2023.

metadata.name: ukiyo-e seascape in bloom #119
metadata.description:
Generative seascape (or lakescape) inspired by ukiyo-e art.
The art is programmatically drawn using basic shapes, easy math, random and noise. (except text typography)

April 2022
ykxotkx

metadata.name: fx(mash) #116
metadata.description:
fx(mash) is my humble contribution to celebrating #fxhashturnsone

This series is based on a simple algorithm - lines of a random length are drawn on a square grid until the grid is full.

I have added a variety of features based on some of my favorite fxhash projects and a few special guests.

This collection is intentionally diverse and disorderly, that's a nice way of saying I only had a short period of time following the release of Acequia. As a result, some of the outputs might be weird, messy, or even bordering on broken (if you get one of the latter please let me know and I'll reimburse you).

Despite being a bit rough around the edges, I hope fx(mash) reflects some measure of my love for the fxhash community. If you're feeling kind, then perhaps it even harks back to the experimental early days :)

The last year has been an incredible journey, thank you for letting me be a part of our story so far.

Controls (in live view):

- Press [s] to save the current image
- Press [g] to toggle grain
- Press [h] for a high-res output

Beta Controls (in live view, definitely not fully tested):

- Press [p] to start/pause animation
- Press [i] to slow down animation
- Press [o] to speed up animation

All primary sales go to Savepakistan.


Acknowledgements:

fx(mash) uses Gorilla Sun's grain implementation, a big thanks to him and meezwhite for a great article that is well worth supporting https://www.fxhash.xyz/article/all-about-that-grain

Thank you to the artists who created the following collections. Some were the source for palettes, others directly inspired traits, and some I thought would be fun to include as specific trait values.

metadata.name: Ecce Gratum #28
metadata.description:
"Ecce Gratum" is a symphony of colors and lines, a visual work that sings to the soul. The strokes of the brush are bold and confident, yet gentle and loving, like the notes of a symphony. The title, "Ecce Gratum", translates to "Behold the pleasing", and as you gaze upon this art, it is impossible not to be moved by its beauty and wonder. This painting is a celebration of life, a reminder to embrace the present and to find joy in the simple things. It is a call to look beyond the surface, to see the beauty in the world around us, and to let our hearts sing

[S] on live view to save a png

metadata.name: Energy Refraction #7
metadata.description:
In celebration of one year of fxhash.

This generative work is inspired by color palettes from nature and the universe. The general idea is to simulate in the code, a mix between two traditional forms of painting like watercolor and ink on relief with refraction of light and shadow.


Entirely created in p5js.
License: CC BY-NC-ND 4.0

metadata.name: Faux #188
metadata.description:
This project is borne out of my longstanding fascination with brushwork, and the intricate textures that can be created with a brush, some paint and a canvas. Brush strokes are simulated using many overlapping lines and given texture and depth using a custom shader. Another important aspect of this work, is the composite forms that are created by the brush strokes, which are my attempt to emulate the emphatic energy of many abstract painters that have come before me. Color palettes are named after common paint colors, based on the background color used for the palette.

Those who collect during the first tier of the Dutch Auction can claim a signed print. They will be printed on A3 Hahnemuhle Photo Rag, and shipped to the collector free of charge. More details on how to claim a print and specify the necessary shipping information will be provided via the artists twitter (@landlinesart1).

In live mode, add &size=<YOUR_PIXEL_SIZE> to change the pixel size of the image for export (Right click to save). For example, &size=4000 will set the width of the image to be 4000 pixels.

metadata.name: System Î² #197
metadata.description:
Î± -> Î² is about "Increases in magnitude and decreases in computation". And still related the fleeting time in the generating process.

My role in this work is more of a discoverer than a creator. 

Try to reveal the possibilities of time perception in the generative art through negotiating with incomprehensible mathematical equations.

What I want to explore through this work is that behind the generated results, the dynamic process of generations are equally diverse and unpredictable.

When we watch the generating process displayed on the computer, changing instantly, moving, multiplying, disappearing, and we hesitate, wonder, pause, await, as if many possibilities of time perception have emerged in the fragmented moments.

_
press [1] -> Î² 
press [2] -> Î²â°ã 
press [3] -> Î²Â¹
-
Press [s] in live view to save as PNG.
Press [d] in live view to save as hi-res PNG.
-
If you need your collection in SVG format, feel free to DM me.

metadata.name: Ice Monsters #12
metadata.description: In the frozen land, there lived a family of blue and ice monsters. These monsters were known for their love of cold temperatures and icy environments. They spent their days exploring the frozen tundras and icy lakes, sliding on the frozen surfaces and ice-skating with great speed and skill. They had a unique ability to withstand the extreme cold and enjoyed living in their icy paradise. The blue and ice monsters were skilled in ice sculpting and would often create beautiful ice art that sparkled and glimmered in the bright sunlight. They had a strong bond with the land and the creatures that lived in it, including the penguins and seals that called the icy waters their home. The blue and ice monsters were admired for their resilience and their ability to thrive in the harshest of environments, and their icy paradise was a true wonder to behold.

metadata.name: ecologÃ­as - A #544
metadata.description:
ecologÃ­as - A

lines are a metaphor for the communication all species engage in. We as humans have a need to leave traces - stories - that others can read and learn from. What will be the traces machines want to leave? This piece employs sinusoidal signals drawn with lines as a simple metaphor for every trace and every language, for every message and every communication.

ecologÃ­as-A is an entity that is part of a broader ecology. Released on occasion of the show "Unbound - Ecology in the Age of Machines" at Unit London. The data generated by this entity is read by a different piece minted on Ethereum, creating a link between Tezos and Ethereum, a metaphor for an ecology of blockchains.

it shares a common element with two other works released on fxhash: ecologÃ­as B and ecologÃ­as C, all of them contributing data to aforementioned pieces.

read more at https://www.iillucid.com/ecologias

15% of primary sales are donated to institutions working towards improving biodiversity and environmental efforts.

Marcelo Soria-RodrÃ­guez, @msoriaro
CC BY-NC-SA 4.0, https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/4.0/

Built on p5.js, glsl

append &pd=N (N a number) to the URL in live view to increase/decrease resolution
press s to save current image in current resolution
press z,x,g,b,n followed by +/- to increase/decrease, respectively, brightness, contrast, gamma, blur, noise

metadata.name: TIÂ·ME 0 #75
metadata.description:
How and when Time started has always been one of the biggest questions of the humankind, that is yet to be answered.

There are things we may know, and there are things we may never know. Though, one thing that may be considered as certain is that, it did not start before it was started to be measured.

* * *

This generative artwork is a gift to my dear collectors of TIÂ·ME series (TIÂ·ME I, TIÂ·ME II & TIÂ·ME III).

Any collector who is holding 3 or more pieces of any of the three TIÂ·ME collections mentioned above at the snapshot time of Aug 22, 18:00 UTC, will receive a piece from TIÂ·ME 0 sent to their wallet. One piece per each 3 pieces held, i.e., if you have 9 pieces in total from any TIÂ·ME collections combined, you will receive 3 pieces. Remaining pieces (if any), will be sent to randomly selected collectors who have less than 3 pieces.

Thank you very much for collecting and for your continuous support. Only with that, I can continue to do what I love.

Press S to save as PNG.

Made by: yenren / twitter.com/yenrenART
License: LICENSE.txt

metadata.description:
"Dot" is a generative abstract work 100% code, no images used.


CONTROLS

KEYS:

- S: Save a png file with the current resolution

- R: Reload

----
Made with p5js and custom shaders


Â© July 2023  @Uniray_net | uniray.net

metadata.name: Tribal Spirit #12
metadata.description:
"Tribal Spirit" is a generative collection combining primitive flow lines with natural earth and "wooden" colors, in a harmonic decorative composition, bringing memories of traveling, local art, wild life, nature and nuances of tribal spirit. 


KEY POINTS:

- 8 background colors, 16 palettes (x5 colors each), unlimited shape patterns
- Info popup while generating the graphics
- Help screen
- Variable levels of quality 
- Progressive rendering (avoid long lasting "empty" waiting screens). 
- New generative art on each click (for each minted token)


CONTROLS & INTERACTIVITY

KEYS:

1-4: Set resolution (1x to 4x of the current size)
H: High quality rendering (slow), 
N: Normal quality
L: Low quality (faster)
S: Save a png image with the current resolution and quality
SPACEBAR: Toggle a help screen
R: Reset - reload

MOUSE:

CLICK: Generate a new art on each click 


Note: Possibly there will be a delayed response during interaction. The process is computationally demanding in general. 

----
LIBRARY: p5js
LICENCE: See the LICENSE.md

Thank you!

Â© Sep. 2022  @Uniray_net | uniray.net

objkt.name: Ode to Bugs and Happy Accidents #115

metadata.name: Ode to Bugs and Happy Accidents #115
metadata.description:
âIf debugging is the process of removing software bugs, then programming must be the process of putting them in.â

âÂ Edsger W. Dijkstra


This artwork is dedicated to happy accidents, mistakes, and bugs. Every key part of it is based on some sort of failure: wrong variable value, unstopped recursion, untimely function call. And sometimes it leads to pleasant results.

It was created to celebrate #fxhashturnsone event.

The earnings are partly donated to:
- Processing Foundation
- #TezosStandsWithUkraine

[a] - toggle animation
[1] - save PNG in low resolution
[2] - save PNG in medium resolution
[3] - save PNG in high resolution
[4] - save PNG in ultra-high resolution

Saving with high and ultra-high resolution may take a while, please be patient.


Made with love and p5js

By Collapsar Beauty
CC BY-NC-ND 4.0

issuer.name: Ode to Bugs and Happy Accidents

metadata.name: Emotions #7
metadata.description:
1) INTRO (MUST READ)
"Emotions" is a unique Animated, watercolor or liquid painting-like abstract generative artwork which incorporates some "innovative" or unique techniques and approaches.

If find the above too selfish or wonder if its worth to buy this sh**t in a relative high price from an unknown "artist" please give some time to read the whole description. You will not regret!

I don't like to talk about myself or using marketing expressions, however sometimes have to, in order to clarify some points & spot some important features

All started as an exercise to shaders on Nov. 2022 and is the completion of this experimentation (rotating colors): twitter.com/Uniray_net/status/1587588272842280961 


2) SHORT BIO
I was always between graphics & programming. Was very good in both areas (as my teachers were saying) & remember me also drawing from childhood 
The first years i was focusing more in graphics (i was teaching graphics as well) and i was programming graphics for hobby

From 2005 & later i started a turn in my career & made programming my profession for the last 13-14 years (developer in some private companies)
In 2020 I started again a more serious involvement with graphics without knowing anything about NFTs or WEB3. And from 2021 i started getting more & more involved. Still so many to learn

I am new in gen art, started few months ago with plain javascript.
Started learning p5js in Aug. 2002 and shaders in Oct. 2022 & "Emotions" is my first "large" work. 
Already published some simpler & old works (eg. 3D) & things i developed as i was learning

3) FEATURES
I think i am presenting something relatively different with "Emotions" & always try to apply one of my favorite motto: "Lead, don't follow"

The general experience in programming & the fact that i had already programmed graphics in conjunction with my love for experimentation & searching behind the things, helped me to incorporate in "Emotions" some "innovative" i believe features & techniques (it sounds selfish but let me explain)

- First i am "proud" of the shader work. I developed completely custom "advanced" techniques that discovered after experimentation & some knowledge of course.

- "Emotions" includes 51 palettes (with several color each) that have been stored externally (in the application folder) as Adobe ".act" color table files so that avoiding hard coded (including all palettes in the code) consuming in this way resources eg. memory from user's system. I just load only the one palette i am going to use

- A fast svg Convolution kernel Matrix filter along with a displacement filter used for the texture

- Lastly & minor, you can switch Orientation (Portrait, Landscape, etc) & Resolution with the press of a key (no need to manually add params in the url)

From the above the most important part is the webGL shader.

4) CONCLUSION
"Emotions" is an animated watercolor painting-like (or liquid pigments material) abstract "live" work, that instead of staying static, starting with an initial state & slowly flowing, changing shapes & colors as sometimes happens with our emotions & feelings which may changed over time. 
Colors also represents emotions eg. red is for passion, green is the color of hope, etc 

Give some time to observe the progress and liquid feel and motion in shapes and colors.  Relax and look the flow and color diffusion - spread  & the whole "painting" to transformed slowly. 

KEYS:
- 1-4: Set resolution from 1x to 4x of the current dimension (slower performance in higher values)
- T: Texture on/off
- S: Save a png file with the current resolution

- P: Change orientation to Portrait (default). Aspect ratio 0.75
- L: Change orientation to Landscape with ratio 4/3
- O: Change orientation to Square (box)
  Due to some 1:1 ratio sensitive calculations, rendering output may differ between orientations

- Spacebar: animation on/off

MOUSE:
- Click: animation on/off
- Move: left - right on canvas (when in animation) to interact

----
Made with p5js & custom shaders. Pure code. No Images used

Â© Dec. 2022  @Uniray_net | uniray.net
